text:
In the process of building an audit file to identify all versions and other 
info specific to an automated build, I call Echoproperties with a destination 
file. Unfortunately this overwrites the existing file, so I cannot apply nice 
header formatting. Also I would like to sort the properties... It is hard to 
navigate the list in the random order they appear in. Adding optional sort and 
append attributes would be a nice improvement and would retain current 
operation.
creator: jeffwsmi@us.ibm.com
mbenson@apache.org
text:
In CVS HEAD echoproperties sorts all properties; removing that portion of the
request from summary (better not to mix multiple RFEs in a single report).

I need echoproperties to overwrite the file if it already exist. Perhaps it is 
better to add an attribute to <echoproperties> where you can specify if you 
want to overwrite the file or not.
creator: maarten_coene@yahoo.com

text:
concat, echo, record doesnt do that so it would be incosistent.
If you dont want to overwrite the file, <move> the existing one to another name
or use a conditional target for writing.

<available property="p.present" file="echoed.properties"/>
<target name="echoproperties" unless="p.present">
    <echoproperties file="echoed.properties"/>
</target>
creator: jan@materne.de
